content: Looking up, He saw the rich people putting their gifts into the treasury.
And He saw a poor widow putting in two small copper coins.

As some were talking about the temple, that it was decorated with beautiful stones and consecrated offerings [of magnificent gifts of gold which were displayed on the walls and hung in the porticoes], He said,
They asked Him, “Teacher, when will these things happen? And what will be the sign when these things are about to happen?”
He said,  [appropriating for themselves the name Messiah which belongs to Me alone],   [civil unrest, revolts, uprisings],

Then Jesus told them,   [deadly and devastating]   [about Me].   [skillful]    [your association with]    [patient]  [empowered by the Holy Spirit]  [hostile]  [with confident assurance]   [out]   [of rendering full justice or satisfaction],   [Israel].
[there will be]   [dreadful]  [very]   [transcendent, overwhelming]  [subduing the nations]   [in joy],  [suffering ends as]

Then He told them a parable:    [without any doubt]   [those living at that definite period of time preceding the second coming]   [when the Messiah returns]    [be attentive and ready],  [to be found worthy and]  [at His coming].”
Now in the daytime Jesus was teaching in [the porches and courts of] the temple, but at night He would go out and spend the night on the mount that is called Olivet.
And early in the morning all the people would come to Him in the temple to listen to Him.
